Tariff.description: Information about the tariff that are static and does not change during at least a month.

name.description: Descriptive short name of the grid tariff.

description.description: Detailed description of the grid tariff.

product.description: Name of the grid company product, for grid company internal use.

companyName.description: Name of the grid company. Ex. Elvia AS

companyOrgNo.description: Organization number of the grid company. Ex. 980489698

isConsumptionTariff.description: Indicates if this is a tariff for consumption or production. True = consumption, False = production.

lastUpdated.description: The time of when the prices were last updated on the server side. No need to get prices if you already fetched the latest ones? Ex. 2021-11-05T00:00:00+01:00

priceDefinitions.description: Price definitions that can be used to calculate the cost for a consumer.

FixedPriceConfiguration.description: Parameters to visualize how the fixed price component is calculated. Ex. if months > 1, then the average of the maxhoursPerMonth for x months is the basis for the fixed price etc. Weighting is not supported in this version.

basis.description: The basis category of the fixed price component.

PowerPriceConfiguration.description: Parameters to visualize how the fixed price component is calculated. Ex. if months > 1, then the average of the maxhoursPerMonth for x months is the basis for the fixed price etc. Weighting is not supported in this version.

peakPricingPeriod.description:
The peak pricing period is a consecutive time period in which peaks are identified to calculate the power price.
Duration of the period in [ISO 8601 duration format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).
Examples:
- "P1D" for one day
- "P1M" for one month
- "P2W" for two weeks
- "P3Y6M4DT12H30M5S" for a complex duration.

peakIdentificationPeriod.description: The time period as an ISO 8601 duration for identifying one single peak to be used in calculations. For example only one peak per day is saved => "P1D".

peakDuration.description: The time length as an ISO 8601 duration for calculating average power to get one peak.

numberOfPeaks.description: The number of peaks within a peak pricing period for calculating average peak for that period.
